what: Easy loading of sciT loom files
title: Easy loading of sciT loom files
text: companion R package sciT-snakemake workflow

title: Easy loading of sciT loom files
text: LoadSciLooms R package designed companion SciT_snakemake pipeline. SciT_snakemake performs heavy lifting preprocessing single-cell combinatorial indexing transcriptomics (sciT) data (demultiplexing, alignment, counting, QC, loom generation), LoadSciLooms provides R-side tooling needed : Load sciT-generated .loom files R Convert Seurat objects Optionally perform Gaussian Mixture Model (GMM)–based cell calling Optionally use Odd-barcodes add metadata Seurat objects Merge multiple sciT libraries preserving provenance metadata Keep analysis parameters model objects bundled data short: SciT_snakemake → .loom files → LoadSciLooms → Seurat-based analysis

title: Easy loading of sciT loom files
text: Thus, package can used load sciT-snakemake-processed data R analysis.

title: Easy loading of sciT loom files
code: FASTQ files ↓ SciT_snakemake ↓ Transcriptome .loom files ↓ LoadSciLooms (this package) ↓ Seurat objects (optionally with Gmm cell-calls and/or Odd-barcode derived metadata) ↓ Downstream analysis (clustering, annotation, visualization)

title: Easy loading of sciT loom files
Easy loading of sciT loom files
text: SeuratObject rhdf5 Matrix mclust automatically installed missing.

title: Easy loading of sciT loom files
text: major functions package return object class lseurat. lseurat object lightweight container keeps data, parameters, models together.

what: Loading a sciT loom file into R
title: Easy loading of sciT loom files
text: running SciT_snakemake, load transcriptome loom file: creates: sparse transcriptome matrix Seurat object cell feature metadata lseurat container capturing multiple parameters
code: # Load as seuratobject Loom_path <- "path/to/libraries/i31-sample1-1K/transcriptome_se.loom" lseurat <- LoomAsSeurat(Loom_path, matrix_rowname_col = "Gene",                         resolve_duplicates = TRUE,                         gmm_cell_calling = FALSE)

title: Easy loading of sciT loom files
text: SciT data often contains mixture real cells background barcodes. LoadSciLooms optionally performs Gaussian Mixture Model–based cell calling using total transcript counts. Results: Cell classifications stored lseurat$seurat$gmm Fitted model stored lseurat$gmm
code: lseurat <- LoomAsSeurat(   loom_path = "transcriptome.loom",   gmm_cell_calling = TRUE,   gmm_k = 1:6,   gmm_verbose = TRUE )

title: Easy loading of sciT loom files
text: SciT-datasets often combine multiple treatments conditions. Using Odd-barcodes cells, can annotate metadata loading Seurat objects. functionalty, need provide comma-seperated file links Odd-barcode IDs metadata. takes form two columns: example file can found . can change layout matches sciT-dataset. example file used:
code: Odd_barcode,Condition Odd2Bo1,DMSO Odd2Bo2,DMSO Odd2Bo3,DMSO --- Odd2Bo25,Treatment_A Odd2Bo26,Treatment_A Odd2Bo27,Treatment_A --- Odd2Bo52,Treatment_B Odd2Bo53,Treatment_B Odd2Bo54,Treatment_B --- Odd2Bo79,Treatment_C Odd2Bo80,Treatment_C Odd2Bo81,Treatment_C loom_file <- system.file("extdata", "i31_GSK126_subsample.loom",   package = "LoadSciLooms") odd_md_file <- system.file("extdata", "Odd_barcode_md.csv",   package = "LoadSciLooms")  lseurat_odd <- LoomAsSeurat(   loom_path = loom_file,   matrix_rowname_col = "Gene",   matrix_colname_col = "CellID",   resolve_duplicates = FALSE,   Add_Odd_bc_md = TRUE,   Odd_barcode_md_file = odd_md_file,   full_barcode_col = "BC" )  # Resulting Seurat metadata will contain Odd-barcode metadata head(lseurat_odd$seurat[[c("Odd_barcode", "condition")]])

what: Loading and merging multiple sciT libraries
title: Easy loading of sciT loom files
text: experiments processed multiple sciT libraries: Output One lseurat object per input loom merged Seurat object lseurat_list$merged_seurat loom metadata column indicating sample origin
code: loom_paths <- c(   "i31-sample1-1K" = "path/to/i31-sample1-1K.loom",   "i31-sample2-10K" = "path/to/i31-sample2-10K.loom" )  lseurat_list <- MultiLoomAsSeurat(   loom_paths = loom_paths,   merge_seurat = TRUE,   remove_unmerged = TRUE )

title: Easy loading of sciT loom files
text: SciT loom files sciT-snakemake workflow gene symbols ENSEMBL gene IDs. using gene symbols create seurat object, duplicate gene symbols become problematic. Since Seurat allow duplicate feature names: Default behavior: error Optional behavior: automatically resolve duplicates Duplicate features resolved keeping first occurrence.
code: # Load as seuratobject Loom_path <- "path/to/libraries/i31-sample1-1K/transcriptome_se.loom" lseurat <- LoomAsSeurat(Loom_path, matrix_rowname_col = "name",                         resolve_duplicates = TRUE,                         gmm_cell_calling = FALSE)

what: When should I use this package?
title: Easy loading of sciT loom files
text: Use LoadSciLooms : ran SciT_snakemake transcriptome .loom files. want annotate SciT-data Odd-barcode derived metadata. want analyze data Seurat.

title: Easy loading of sciT loom files
text: SciT_snakemake (https://github.com/Suirotras/SciT_snakemake)

what: Add Odd-barcode–derived metadata to a Seurat object — Add_odd_barcode_metadata
title: Add Odd-barcode–derived metadata to a Seurat object — Add_odd_barcode_metadata
text: sciT datasets often consist cells different treatment conditions. Using Odd barcodes embedded full cell barcode, cells can stratified treatment condition. function extracts Odd barcode full barcode stored Seurat metadata, matches user-provided metadata table, adds Odd barcode corresponding condition new metadata columns Seurat object contained within lseurat object.

title: Add Odd-barcode–derived metadata to a Seurat object — Add_odd_barcode_metadata
code: Add_odd_barcode_metadata(   lseurat,   Odd_barcode_md_file,   full_barcode_col = "BC",   condition_col = "condition",   Odd_barcode_col = "Odd_barcode",   Odd_barcode_position = 2 )

title: Add Odd-barcode–derived metadata to a Seurat object — Add_odd_barcode_metadata
text: lseurat object class lseurat containing Seurat object lseurat$seurat. Odd_barcode_md_file comma-separated file linking Odd barcode IDs metadata (e.g. treatment condition). Must contain least two columns: one Odd barcode identifiers one corresponding condition. full_barcode_col Character string specifying column name Seurat metadata contains full cell barcode. Defaults "BC". condition_col Character string specifying name metadata column store condition labels Seurat object. Defaults "condition". Odd_barcode_col Character string specifying name metadata column store extracted Odd barcodes Seurat object. Defaults "Odd_barcode". Odd_barcode_position Integer specifying position Odd barcode splitting full barcode underscores ("_"). Defaults 2.

title: Add Odd-barcode–derived metadata to a Seurat object — Add_odd_barcode_metadata
text: input lseurat object updated Seurat metadata. Two new columns added lseurat$seurat@meta.data: one containing extracted Odd barcodes one containing corresponding condition labels.

title: Add Odd-barcode–derived metadata to a Seurat object — Add_odd_barcode_metadata
text: full barcode split using underscores, element Odd_barcode_position interpreted Odd barcode. Odd barcodes matched metadata file using exact matching.

what: Convert a loom file to a Seurat object — LoomAsSeurat
title: Convert a loom file to a Seurat object — LoomAsSeurat
text: function loads transcriptome loom file converts Seurat object wrapped inside lseurat container. supports optional Gaussian mixture model (GMM)–based cell calling, automatic resolution duplicate feature names, annotation cells using Odd-barcode–linked metadata.

title: Convert a loom file to a Seurat object — LoomAsSeurat
code: LoomAsSeurat(   loom_path,   matrix_rowname_col = "Gene",   matrix_colname_col = "CellID",   gmm_cell_calling = FALSE,   gmm_k = 1:6,   gmm_verbose = TRUE,   resolve_duplicates = FALSE,   Add_Odd_bc_md = FALSE,   Odd_barcode_md_file = NULL,   full_barcode_col = "BC",   condition_col = "condition",   Odd_barcode_col = "Odd_barcode",   Odd_barcode_position = 2,   seurat_assay_name = "RNA",   seurat_min_cells = 0,   seurat_names_field = 1L,   seurat_names_delim = "_",   ... )

title: Convert a loom file to a Seurat object — LoomAsSeurat
text: loom_path single-element character vector specifying path transcriptome loom file. matrix_rowname_col single-element character vector indicating column row (gene) metadata loom file used feature names count matrix. matrix_colname_col single-element character vector indicating column column (cell) metadata loom file used cell names count matrix. gmm_cell_calling Logical value indicating whether GMM-based cell calling performed. Default FALSE. gmm_k Integer vector specifying number(s) mixture components test. model lowest BIC selected. Default 1:6. gmm_verbose Logical value indicating whether information selected GMM (BIC number components) printed. resolve_duplicates Logical value indicating whether duplicate feature names resolved automatically. TRUE, first occurrence duplicated feature retained. FALSE, function errors duplicates detected. Default FALSE. Add_Odd_bc_md Logical value indicating whether Odd-barcode metadata annotation performed. Default FALSE. Odd_barcode_md_file comma-separated file linking Odd barcode IDs metadata (e.g. treatment condition). Must contain least two columns: one Odd barcode identifiers one corresponding condition. full_barcode_col Character string specifying column Seurat metadata contains full cell barcode. condition_col Character string specifying name metadata column store condition labels. Odd_barcode_col Character string specifying name metadata column store extracted Odd barcodes. Odd_barcode_position Integer specifying position Odd barcode splitting full barcode underscores ("_"). seurat_assay_name single-element character vector specifying name assay created Seurat object. seurat_min_cells Include features detected least many cells. seurat_names_field Integer specifying substring cell name (splitting seurat_names_delim) used sample name. seurat_names_delim single-element character vector specifying delimiter used split cell names extracting sample names. ... Additional arguments passed SeuratObject::CreateSeuratObject().

title: Convert a loom file to a Seurat object — LoomAsSeurat
text: object class lseurat. named list containing: seurat Seurat object containing count matrix metadata derived loom file. params named list parameters supplied LoomAsSeurat(). gmm Mclust object used cell calling, NA GMM-based cell calling performed.

title: Convert a loom file to a Seurat object — LoomAsSeurat
text: Arguments: loom_path, matrix_rowname_col, matrix_colname_col. Control loom file read features cells identified.

title: Convert a loom file to a Seurat object — LoomAsSeurat
text: Arguments: seurat_assay_name, seurat_min_cells, seurat_names_field, seurat_names_delim, .... Control creation, filtering, naming Seurat object.

title: Convert a loom file to a Seurat object — LoomAsSeurat
text: Arguments: resolve_duplicates. Control duplicate feature names detected resolved.

title: Convert a loom file to a Seurat object — LoomAsSeurat
text: Arguments: gmm_cell_calling, gmm_k, gmm_verbose. Control Gaussian mixture model–based classification cells.

title: Convert a loom file to a Seurat object — LoomAsSeurat
text: Arguments: Add_Odd_bc_md, Odd_barcode_md_file, full_barcode_col, condition_col, Odd_barcode_col, Odd_barcode_position. Control annotation cells using Odd-barcode–linked metadata.

title: Convert a loom file to a Seurat object — LoomAsSeurat
code: # Example 1: basic loom loading lpath <- system.file("extdata", "i1_ES_subsample.loom",   package = "LoadSciLooms") lseurat <- LoomAsSeurat(   lpath,   matrix_rowname_col = "Gene",   matrix_colname_col = "CellID",   resolve_duplicates = FALSE,   seurat_assay_name = "RNA",   seurat_min_cells = 0,   seurat_names_field = 1L,   seurat_names_delim = "_" )  # Example 2: loom loading with Odd-barcode metadata annotation loom_file <- system.file("extdata", "i31_GSK126_subsample.loom",   package = "LoadSciLooms") odd_md_file <- system.file("extdata", "Odd_barcode_md.csv",   package = "LoadSciLooms") lseurat_odd <- LoomAsSeurat(   loom_path = loom_file,   matrix_rowname_col = "Gene",   matrix_colname_col = "CellID",   resolve_duplicates = FALSE,   Add_Odd_bc_md = TRUE,   Odd_barcode_md_file = odd_md_file,   full_barcode_col = "BC" )  # Resulting Seurat metadata will contain Odd-barcode metadata head(lseurat_odd$seurat[[c("Odd_barcode", "condition")]]) #>                                  Odd_barcode   condition #> i31-FV-GSK126-1K_multiome_100859    Odd2Bo60 Treatment_B #> i31-FV-GSK126-1K_multiome_101271    Odd2Bo88 Treatment_C #> i31-FV-GSK126-1K_multiome_102301    Odd2Bo62 Treatment_B #> i31-FV-GSK126-1K_multiome_102545    Odd2Bo18        DMSO #> i31-FV-GSK126-1K_multiome_103754    Odd2Bo75 Treatment_C #> i31-FV-GSK126-1K_multiome_104        Odd2Bo9        DMSO

what: Convert multiple loom files to a merged Seurat object — MultiLoomAsSeurat
title: Convert multiple loom files to a merged Seurat object — MultiLoomAsSeurat
text: function converts multiple transcriptome loom files individual Seurat objects using LoomAsSeurat optionally merges single Seurat object. loom file tracked user-supplied identifier, stored cell-level metadata resulting Seurat object(s).

title: Convert multiple loom files to a merged Seurat object — MultiLoomAsSeurat
code: MultiLoomAsSeurat(   loom_paths,   matrix_rowname_col = "Gene",   matrix_colname_col = "CellID",   gmm_cell_calling = FALSE,   gmm_k = 1:6,   gmm_verbose = TRUE,   merge_seurat = TRUE,   remove_unmerged = TRUE,   resolve_duplicates = FALSE,   Add_Odd_bc_md = FALSE,   Odd_barcode_md_file = NULL,   full_barcode_col = "BC",   condition_col = "condition",   Odd_barcode_col = "Odd_barcode",   Odd_barcode_position = 2,   seurat_assay_name = "RNA",   seurat_min_cells = 0,   seurat_names_field = 1L,   seurat_names_delim = "_",   ... )

title: Convert multiple loom files to a merged Seurat object — MultiLoomAsSeurat
text: loom_paths named character vector specifying paths transcriptome loom files. names used sample identifiers stored cell metadata (column loom) resulting Seurat object(s). matrix_rowname_col single-element character vector indicating column row (gene) metadata loom files used feature names count matrix. matrix_colname_col single-element character vector indicating column column (cell) metadata loom files used cell names count matrix. gmm_cell_calling Logical value indicating whether GMM-based cell calling performed loom file. Default FALSE. gmm_k Integer vector specifying number(s) mixture components test. model lowest BIC selected. Default 1:6. gmm_verbose Logical value indicating whether information selected GMM (BIC number components) printed. merge_seurat Logical value indicating whether individual Seurat objects merged single Seurat object. remove_unmerged Logical value indicating whether individual Seurat objects removed merging. argument ignored merge_seurat = FALSE. resolve_duplicates Logical value indicating whether duplicate feature names resolved automatically. TRUE, first occurrence duplicated feature retained. FALSE, function errors duplicates detected. Default FALSE. Add_Odd_bc_md Logical value indicating whether Odd-barcode metadata annotation performed. Default FALSE. Odd_barcode_md_file comma-separated file linking Odd barcode IDs metadata (e.g. treatment condition). Must contain least two columns: one Odd barcode identifiers one corresponding condition. full_barcode_col Character string specifying column Seurat metadata contains full cell barcode. condition_col Character string specifying name metadata column store condition labels. Odd_barcode_col Character string specifying name metadata column store extracted Odd barcodes. Odd_barcode_position Integer specifying position Odd barcode splitting full barcode underscores ("_"). seurat_assay_name single-element character vector specifying name assay created Seurat object(s). seurat_min_cells Include features detected least many cells. seurat_names_field Integer specifying substring cell name (splitting seurat_names_delim) used sample name. seurat_names_delim single-element character vector specifying delimiter used split cell names extracting sample names. ... Additional arguments passed SeuratObject::CreateSeuratObject().

title: Convert multiple loom files to a merged Seurat object — MultiLoomAsSeurat
text: named list containing: merged_seurat merged Seurat object merge_seurat = TRUE, otherwise NA. <sample_id> One element per loom file, object class lseurat containing Seurat object, parameters, optional GMM results.

title: Convert multiple loom files to a merged Seurat object — MultiLoomAsSeurat
text: Arguments: loom_paths, matrix_rowname_col, matrix_colname_col. Control multiple loom files specified features cells identified.

title: Convert multiple loom files to a merged Seurat object — MultiLoomAsSeurat
text: Arguments: seurat_assay_name, seurat_min_cells, seurat_names_field, seurat_names_delim, .... Control creation, filtering, naming Seurat objects derived loom file.

title: Convert multiple loom files to a merged Seurat object — MultiLoomAsSeurat
text: Arguments: resolve_duplicates. Control duplicate feature names detected resolved.

title: Convert multiple loom files to a merged Seurat object — MultiLoomAsSeurat
text: Arguments: gmm_cell_calling, gmm_k, gmm_verbose. Control Gaussian mixture model–based classification cells loom file.

title: Convert multiple loom files to a merged Seurat object — MultiLoomAsSeurat
text: Arguments: Add_Odd_bc_md, Odd_barcode_md_file, full_barcode_col, condition_col, Odd_barcode_col, Odd_barcode_position. Control annotation cells using Odd-barcode–linked metadata.

title: Convert multiple loom files to a merged Seurat object — MultiLoomAsSeurat
text: Arguments: merge_seurat, remove_unmerged. Control whether individual Seurat objects merged whether unmerged objects retained.

title: Convert multiple loom files to a merged Seurat object — MultiLoomAsSeurat
code: ## Example 1: Regular loading and merging of multiple loom files lpaths <- c(   "i1_ES"  = system.file("extdata", "i1_ES_subsample.loom",                          package = "LoadSciLooms"),   "i3_d6"  = system.file("extdata", "i3_d6_subsample.loom",                          package = "LoadSciLooms"),   "i5_d17" = system.file("extdata", "i5_d17_subsample.loom",                          package = "LoadSciLooms") ) lseurat_list <- MultiLoomAsSeurat(   lpaths,   matrix_rowname_col = "Gene",   matrix_colname_col = "CellID",   seurat_assay_name = "RNA",   seurat_min_cells = 0,   seurat_names_field = 1L,   seurat_names_delim = "_" ) #> Converting i1_ES to seurat #> Converting i3_d6 to seurat #> Converting i5_d17 to seurat  ## Example 2: loom loading with Odd-barcode metadata annotation lpaths <- c(   "dummy_sample1" = system.file("extdata", "i31_GSK126_subsample.loom",                                 package = "LoadSciLooms"),   "dummy_sample2" = system.file("extdata", "i31_GSK126_subsample.loom",                                 package = "LoadSciLooms"),   "dummy_sample3" = system.file("extdata", "i31_GSK126_subsample.loom",                                 package = "LoadSciLooms") ) odd_md_file <- system.file("extdata", "Odd_barcode_md.csv",   package = "LoadSciLooms") lseurat_list_odd <- MultiLoomAsSeurat(   lpaths,   matrix_rowname_col = "Gene",   matrix_colname_col = "CellID",   Add_Odd_bc_md = TRUE,   Odd_barcode_md_file = odd_md_file,   remove_unmerged = TRUE,   full_barcode_col = "BC"   ) #> Converting dummy_sample1 to seurat #> Converting dummy_sample2 to seurat #> Converting dummy_sample3 to seurat #> Warning: Some cell names are duplicated across objects provided. Renaming to enforce unique cell names.  # Resulting merged-Seurat metadata will contain Odd-barcode metadata head(lseurat_list_odd$merged_seurat[[c("Odd_barcode", "condition")]]) #>                                    Odd_barcode   condition #> i31-FV-GSK126-1K_multiome_100859_1    Odd2Bo60 Treatment_B #> i31-FV-GSK126-1K_multiome_101271_1    Odd2Bo88 Treatment_C #> i31-FV-GSK126-1K_multiome_102301_1    Odd2Bo62 Treatment_B #> i31-FV-GSK126-1K_multiome_102545_1    Odd2Bo18        DMSO #> i31-FV-GSK126-1K_multiome_103754_1    Odd2Bo75 Treatment_C #> i31-FV-GSK126-1K_multiome_104_1        Odd2Bo9        DMSO

title: Create a custom
text: function acts constructor custom "lseurat" object, named list containing Seurat object, list parameters, optional gmm object.

title: Create a custom
code: create_lseurat_object(   seurat_obj,   params = list(),   gmm = NA,   loom_path = NA,   id = NA )

title: Create a custom
text: seurat_obj valid SeuratObject. required argument. params named list containing parameters. Defaults empty list. gmm optional gmm model object class 'Mclust'. Defaults NA. loom_path single-element character vector, representing path loom file object generated. id single-element character vector. unique ID chosen represent object (e.g. "i1_ES"). Defaults NA.

title: Create a custom
text: named list object class "lseurat".

title: Create a custom
code: # Example usage with dummy objects that have the correct class. # We'll create simple lists and assign the correct classes to them for the example.  # Create a dummy SeuratObject my_seurat <- list() class(my_seurat) <- "Seurat"  # Create a dummy Mclust object my_gmm <- list(bic = -434.9987, components = 2) class(my_gmm) <- "Mclust"  # Define some parameters all_params <- list(min_mapping_quality = 40, pdf_threshold = 0.0005)  # Scenario 1: Create a lseurat object with all arguments provided lseurat_obj_full <- create_lseurat_object(   seurat_obj = my_seurat,   params = all_params,   gmm = my_gmm,   loom_path = "/path/to/my/file.loom",   id = "i5-TDT3-d17" )  # Scenario 2: Create a lseurat object without gmm, loom_path, or id # (These arguments will use their default NA values) lseurat_obj_basic <- create_lseurat_object(   seurat_obj = my_seurat )  # Check the class of the new objects class(lseurat_obj_full) #> [1] "lseurat" class(lseurat_obj_basic) #> [1] "lseurat"  # You can also check their structure if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   str(lseurat_obj_full)   str(lseurat_obj_basic) } # }

what: Function for calling cells using gaussian mixture models — gmm_cell_caller
title: Function for calling cells using gaussian mixture models — gmm_cell_caller
text: Function calling cells using gaussian mixture models

title: Function for calling cells using gaussian mixture models — gmm_cell_caller
code: gmm_cell_caller(counts, k = 1:6, log_convert = TRUE, verbose = TRUE)

title: Function for calling cells using gaussian mixture models — gmm_cell_caller
text: counts 'counts' atomic integer vector, values represent total read counts per cell (e.g. cDNA gDNA counts). matrix dataframe can also given, case rows correspond cells columns represent separate modalities (e.g. RNA DamID). Thus, cell class membership can determined based multiple modalities. k atomic vector type integer. gmm estimated value 'k', value represents number components gmm. cell classifications based model lowest BIC. prevent testing multiple components select , provide single integer. Default 'k' '1:6'. log_convert Logical value indicating counts log-transformed model estimation. verbose Logical value indicating function message chosen number components corresponding bic.

title: Function for calling cells using gaussian mixture models — gmm_cell_caller
text: two-element list. first element atomic integer vector, integers represent class membership one predicted classes (e.g. 1: 'cell', 2: 'real cell'). second element represents 'Mclust' object used class membership prediction.
